intro: Palicourea roseofaucis, commonly known as the red-veined palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking, velvety leaves with deep red veins and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
